Title: Shettima, Sanusi, others urge African leaders to harness Islamic finance for inclusive growth
Summary: Vice President Kashim Shettima and other leading economic stakeholders have called on African countries to deepen their adoption of Islamic finance for inclusive growth .

Title: HURIWA wants probe, sanctions over alleged escape of soldiers linked to B’Haram
Summary: HURIWA wants probe, sanctions over alleged escape of soldiers linked to B’Haram . The Human Rights Writers Association of Nigeria (HURIWA) has called for immediate sanctions following reports that nine military officers escaped .

Title: DSS dismisses 115 personnel as bandits attack Niger Rep
Summary: The Department of State Services (DSS) dismissed 115 personnel as part of its internal reforms aimed at upholding professionalism . The DSS dismisses 115 personnel in its ongoing internal reforms .

Title: Troops repel B’Haram attack in Borno, kill terrorists
Summary: Troops stopped major attack by Boko Haram and ISWAP fighters on their base in Mallam Fatori, Borno State . Troops repel B’Haram attack in Borno, kill terrorists .

Title: Police commission warns against malfeasance in Anambra polls
Summary: The Police Service Commission (PSC) said it has deployed staff monitors to the three senatorial zones of Anambra State to monitor police .

Title: PDP crisis: North-Central stakeholders fault purported suspension of Damagum
Summary: North-Central stakeholders fault purported suspension of Damagum . Forum described the actions as anti-party activities, a direct assault on the PDP . The forum described it as a violation of the party's constitution .

Title: APC woman leader, 100 supporters defect to NNPP in Kano
Summary: The defectors, led by APC woman leader, Hajiya Sabuwa Tarai, cited the development projects and programmes executed by Gov. Yusuf’s administration .

Title: Zamfara, Sokoto farmers demand security to facilitate peaceful harvest
Summary: Many farms remained under siege because bandits are demanding payments before allowing farmers to access their farms for harvest . Many farms are still under siege . Farmers want security to facilitate peaceful harvest for Zamfara, Sokoto farmers .

Title: Depot petrol price falls to N880.5 per litre as competition heightens
Summary: Depot petrol price falls to N880.5 per litre from N881.5 as competition intensifies in downstream sector . Private depots operating mainly in Warri, Delta state and Calabar, Cross River state, reduced price to N889 per litre . Dangote Refinery, Matrix, A.Y

Title: Alleged Genocide: Former DSS director urges FG to take Trump’s threat seriously
Summary: The Federal Government has dismissed the genocide allegation and insisted that religious freedom is protected . Ejiofor warned against underestimating Trump’s rhetoric .

Title: Excess crude account grows 13% in two years

Title: US lawmaker slams China, backs proposed military action in Nigeria
Summary: US lawmaker, Riley Moore, has criticised China for warning Washington against a proposed military action in Nigeria over alleged genocide against Christians . In a post shared on his X handle on Tuesday, Moore expressed support for US President Donald Trump’s position on defending Christians in Nigeria . He stated that the US had a moral responsibility to defend religious freedom

Title: Toyota hikes profit forecasts despite US tariffs impact
Summary: Japanese auto giant Toyota said on Wednesday it had hiked its operating income and net profit forecasts for the current fiscal year . Title: Passengers protest dollar-only ticket sales by airlines
Summary: As the yuletide approaches, air passengers in Nigeria have expressed deep dissatisfaction over the continued sale of flight tickets in foreign currencies, particularly the US dollar . Many passengers fear that the policy will further inflate airfares and make travel increasingly unaffordable for the average Nigerian . Title: Igbo group begs Tinubu to end Lagos demolitions
Summary: Association of Igbo Town Unions, ASITU has appealed to President Bola Ahmed Tinubu to help stop the demolition of properties owned by Igbos in Lagos State .
